intro: Zornia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Zornia obovata is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in small, pod-like fruits that split open to release the seeds.
